oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from B.R. Sealy to Mrs. Elizabeth Lamb
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to his cousin, Sealy displays the na�ve optimism characteristic of the war's early months: "I have not had the chance to try my spunk yet on the yankeys." Also, "There is no yankeys hear I think if I do not die of sickness I will get home safe; for I don�t apprehend any danger from the yankeys." He brags on his biscuits and laments the lack of paper to write on.
